page.title: 02Education, Skye
page.content: {Knockbreck Primary School-Bun Sgoil {a'Chnuic Bhric in Gaidhlig-stands {within the area of Waternish. The {school serves the villages of Geary, {Gillen, Knockbreck, Lusta, Carnoch, {Trumpan, Hallin, Stein, Lochbay and {Bay. There are sixteen pupils in {school,with only one teacher. The {school meals are cooked on the {premises. Only one pupil walks to {school. The rest are transported {by school bus. When the children {complete their primary education they {go to Portree High School. Half the {children are in-comers to the {area; having come here from Cumbria, {Bolton and Manchester. The local {children all have a knowledge of {the Gaidhlig language although only {one speaks it fluently. A Gaidhlig and {an Art teacher visit us weekly.
